pageContext.description: A modern hilt has been fitted to it. Blade plain with lateral groove near each edge. There is no midrib. Signs of heavy use. Blade is somewhat worn near point + slightly bent. Maximum thickness near hilt.
pageContext.publications: This was probably "G 69 - Roman Sword. Lent by Rev. C.H. Drinkwater, Shrewsbury, to the Exhibition of Shropshire Antiquities, 1898: Shrops Arch. Trans, 2nd Series, Vol. X, Part IV, page XI (not numbered), among exhibits received since the catalogue was compiled.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,1929,Mr. Ivor Rowlands,Restaurant, Llangollen,Bought, among other objects at the sale of the late Rev. C.H. Drinkwater, St. George's Vicarage, Shrewsbury, 1923
pageContext.site: River Thames,(The Rev. W. G. D. Fletcher, F.S.A. understood from Mr. Drinkwater that it came from the Thames, there is no suggestion that is was found in Shropshire).
